patterns_discovered.description: Multi-tier fallback approach: localStorage → browser navigator language → default language (English)
Explicit array definition of RTL languages (Hebrew) for easy CSS/layout conditional application
TypeScript const assertions and type exports (LanguageCode) ensuring compile-time safety for language references
Empty translation objects in config with expectation of population during subsequent subtasks
I18nextProvider positioned as outermost context provider (after BrowserRouter) to ensure all child components have i18n access
Debug flag conditional on import.meta.env.DEV for development-only i18n logging

gotchas_discovered.description: Translation objects initialized as empty objects ({}). Actual Hebrew and English translations must be added in subsequent subtasks or components will have undefined text
react.useSuspense set to false. Component may not handle async translation loading gracefully if translations are loaded dynamically
I18nextProvider must wrap child components but positioned outside ThemeProvider. If order is changed, i18n context may not propagate correctly
Language detection uses localStorage key 'language'. Any rename or inconsistency with other parts of application could break persistence

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully configured i18n framework for Hebrew locale support with proper language detection and TypeScript type safety
details: Installed necessary i18n dependencies (i18next, react-i18next, language detector)
Created modular config structure with clear separation of concerns
Implemented automatic browser language detection with localStorage persistence
Established RTL language support infrastructure for Hebrew
Integrated i18n provider into React component tree at appropriate hierarchy level
Maintained TypeScript type safety throughout configuration
Prepared foundation for translation resource population (Subtask 1-3)

recommendations.recommendation: Populate translation resources in frontend/src/i18n/config.ts for both English and Hebrew locales before component implementation
Consider implementing error boundary for i18n initialization failures to provide graceful degradation if language detection fails
Consider lazy-loading translation bundles by language to reduce initial bundle size when supporting multiple languages
Create a custom hook or context to expose RTL detection (RTL_LANGUAGES array) for use in components that need direction-aware styling
Add unit tests for language detection logic and localStorage persistence before expanding to additional languages
Document the localStorage 'language' key convention to prevent accidental breaking changes during refactoring
